Dev halted like stated here

This thread has three purposes:

  1. General information & discussion about my mods and future plans
  2. Distribution of the CITUtil library all my mods require
  3. Distribution of mini mods I create and want to share (because why not) but which are so tiny that they donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t deserve their own thread

All my mods are now equipped with version files.

However, I decided against shipping mini-AVC, because I think itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s completely up to you if you want to benefit from automatic version checking or not (by installing the full KSP-AVC plugin).

So you shouldnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t even have to disable it once if you donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t like it.

I changed my folder structure and all my mods now need to be placed like this:

KSP folder

* GameData

** CIT

** <Folder with name of mod>

*** <modname> version file

*** <modname> license file

*** Plugins

**** <mod> dll(s)

*** Parts

*** Sounds

** CITUtil.dll

** CITUtil.version

** CITUtil license file

Modders: you are welcome to bundle my plugins if you need them for something (the license permits it anyway), but IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢d like to ask you to stick with the folder structure I intended & include the version files, because:

  1. I assume this structure and may make changes breaking something if the actual one differs
  2. I do not handle loading different versions of libs/parts so if you put my lib into your mod folder itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s easily possible that the user ends up with two versions and bad bugs you and I have then to deal with
  3. When I update the version all users who want to be should be notified

Alright, first mini mod.

IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢mÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ special I want to play with funds, but dislike the science (the current hop around and click parts thing is nothing I want to be bothered with) and the contracts system (I do my own missions, if I want to perform repetitive tasks over and over again I can stay at work (yes also with FinePrint though it makes it a lot better)).

Luckily KSP allows me to mod my stupidity away and let me have fun without understanding the game

So since I donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t care about science & contracts but want to pay for unlocking parts in the tech tree and of course for vessels I had to come up with a different solution to get money until IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m able to harvest resources. And yes, the new difficulties panel is nice and helps, but it still doesnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t fit the way I personally want to play.

Therefore, I created an add-on with a simple menu visible in the space center scene which allows me to set the following:

  • Funding I receive from a fictitious government
  • Fix costs I have to pay for maintenance and my employees
  • The interval in which I want to receive and get paid
  • One time insta-penalties & boni
  • Enable and disable the payments

There is no advanced logic in the background (like determining amounts based on reputation) but I role-play everything thatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s going on in my head. I personally like it to be challenging (otherwise I could play sandbox right away) and follow roughly this plan:

  1. Getting some money to get me started until I can harvest resources
  2. Increasing the fix costs with the size of my program until they exceed the received funding
  3. If I complete a mission (my own ones) I pay me a bonus, if I fail a penalty (on top of no-reverting)
  4. While timewarping a few years I either disable it (at the start of the career) or adjust the funding/costs to not sit on a pile of money afterwards (or if IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m lazy I pay a fake Ã¢â‚¬Å“penaltyÃ¢â‚¬Â to get rid of the extra money)

Important: to keep resource usage as low as possible the interval is not bound to timewarp (it checks every ~0.5-2sec if the interval in-game has been reached). If you are timewarping very fast it can happen that multiple days no transaction occurs. Once it does it takes the elapsed time into account and multiplies the amounts accordingly. Since this is true for grants & costs you shouldnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t notice it.

You see, this mod is heavily tailored to the way I want to play so itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s quite possible you dislike it strongly. ThatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s not a problem, just donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t use it, I only want to share everything I create in case there is a single person out there who wants to use it.

Support for blizzyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s toolbar is in to show/hide the window, but the toolbar itself is not bundled (IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m not a big fan of bundles).
